required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Micronutrients and Health in Adult Chinese

lead_sponsor.agency: Shenzhen Center for Chronic Disease Control

clinical_study.source: Shenzhen Center for Chronic Disease Control

brief_summary.textblock: Adult subjects were recruited from a health examination center. Their fasting blood samples were collected for laboratory analyses of multiple measures including mineral, glucose, lipids, etc.

primary_outcome.description: Glucose (mmol/L) was measured in less than 4 hours after sample collection

primary_outcome.measure: circulation concentrations of 4 types of lipids
primary_outcome.description: TG, TC, LDLC, and HDLC (mmol/L) were measured in less than 4 hours after sample collection
all samples were stored at minus 75 degrees Celsius until ready for analysis collectively on a ICP-MS machine for calcium, cobalt, iron, selenium, and zinc (ng/ml)

secondary_outcome.description: body weight (kg) and hight (m) were measured when the volunteers were visiting the health examination center, and the body mass index was calculated later by the formula of body weight/ hight/ hight (kg/m^2).
all samples were stored at minus 75 degrees Celsius until ready for analysis collectively with ELISA kits (nmol/L)

biospec_descr.textblock: Blood samples were collected and separated by centrifugation for supernatant and blood cells.

study_pop.textblock: Adult volunteers visiting a health examination center were randomly recruited with their consent to particiapate the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult volunteer
- Han population
- living in Shenzhen City for > 2 y
Exclusion Criteria:
- caught by organic diseases
- in pregnancy

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shenzhen Center for Chronic Disease Control
